metadata.title: CVE-2014-2283 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
epan/dissectors/packet-rlc in the RLC dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before1.8.13 and 1.10.x before 1.10.6 uses inconsistent memory-managementapproaches, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(use-after-free error and application crash) via a crafted UMTS Radio LinkControl packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
